column4: yus video thumbnails are working now that i installed codecs.
I installed the codecs here, https://help.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/desktopguide/C/codecs.html
after reading here, https://help.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/desktopguide/C/video.html#dvdplayback
anyone know how to control what frame nautilus takes a video frame from?
thanks anyway slart
you can setup what does the thumbnails using gconf, the default one for most video files is gnome-video-thumbnailer
gconf-editor
how much do you want to do what you want to do?
for all video files?

you have two options: 1) Find a thumbnailer that lets you specify the frame 2) hack totem-video-thumbnailer (since I don't see a way to specify the frame).  You set the program used to thumbnail for a certain filetype in /desktop/gnome/thumbnailers in gconf
ah, then use what Slart just said in gconf-editor
/desktop/gnome/thumbnailers
yes, and what do you see when you click on one...
yes, so now add the -t option you want
don't know.  One is probably the path to the file
paste the command you used
didn't we find out already?
did you ever answer my question about the command you used?
what was the question again?
what command are you now using in gconf?
that will work.  Did you delete the old thumbnails so nautilus will rebuild?
then are you sure that the file you are looking at has mime-type video@x-avi?
you don't need to kill nautilus, just do 'rm -r ~/.thumbnails/*' and hit refresh.  To check the mime-type, right click on your file and go to properties
what is confusing?
